title: Prepare Ingredients
description: Chop bacon, separate egg yolks, and grate cheese.
original_steps: Cut about half a pound of thick-cut bacon into three-quarter inch pieces.
Chop bacon into small pieces.
In a bowl, whisk together three whole eggs and two egg yolks.
Separate egg yolks from egg whites and place the yolks in a bowl.
Grate three ounces each of Pecorino Romano and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese.
Mix the grated cheeses into the egg mixture.
Grate pecorino romano cheese and add it to the egg yolks.

title: Cook Bacon
description: Cook bacon until crispy and let it cool.
original_steps: Heat a pan over medium heat and add a tiny bit of olive oil (optional).
Add the bacon to the pan and slowly render out the fat until the bacon is crispy.
Once the bacon is crispy, remove some pieces for garnish and drain most of the fat, leaving about two tablespoons in the pan. Turn off the heat.
Cook the bacon in a pan until crispy, then turn off the heat and let it cool slightly.

title: Mix Egg and Cheese
description: Combine egg yolks, cheese, and pepper.
original_steps: Add fresh ground black pepper to the egg and cheese mixture to taste.
Add freshly ground black pepper to the egg yolk and cheese mixture and mix well.
Add a small amount of reserved pasta water to the egg yolk and cheese mixture to help melt the cheese.

title: Cook Pasta
description: Boil spaghetti until al dente and reserve pasta water.
original_steps: Boil about four quarts of water and add a tablespoon of kosher salt.
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water until slightly al dente, about 10 minutes.
Boil water in a pot, add salt, and cook spaghetti until al dente.
Reserve some pasta water and drain the spaghetti.
Reserve some pasta water before draining the spaghetti.

title: Combine Ingredients
description: Mix pasta with bacon and egg mixture to create sauce.
original_steps: Add the spaghetti to the pan with the bacon fat (heat still off).
Transfer the cooked spaghetti directly from the pot to the pan with bacon, mixing well.
Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot spaghetti, stirring gently to avoid scrambling the eggs.
Pour the egg yolk and cheese mixture over the spaghetti and bacon, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce.

title: Finish and Serve
description: Adjust sauce consistency and garnish before serving.
original_steps: If needed, add reserved pasta water to achieve a creamy consistency.
If needed, add more reserved pasta water to achieve the desired sauce consistency.
Plate the pasta and garnish with additional grated cheese and crispy bacon pieces.
Finish with additional grated pecorino romano or parmesan cheese and more black pepper before serving.
